gcci.text: The stable H100 price of $3.12 per hour indicates that supply chain bottlenecks have largely resolved, enabling more predictable capex planning and wider chip availability for AI workloads.

gtpi.text: DeepSeek’s $1.35 per million input tokens pricing triggers an API price war that compresses margins and pushes other providers to improve model efficiency to stay competitive.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual electricity load for AI data centers underscores rising grid strain, prompting accelerated nuclear and renewable deployment to keep carbon emissions within target ranges.

aipi.text: The confluence of sub-$4 hardware rates and sub-$2 token costs hints at a potential AI bubble; long-term growth will depend on balancing capacity expansion with energy sustainability and regulatory safeguards.
